application_type_full: Householder planning & demolition in a conservation area
decision_conditions: REASON: The proposed two storey extension, by reason of its height, depth and location, would form a visually dominant addition which would fail to be visually subordinate to the host building. The extension would be visible from the surrounding private realm and would fail to preserve or enhance the character and appearance of the host property, wider terrace and conservation area.  The proposal is therefore contrary to paragraph 196 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019, Policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021), Policies CS8 and CS9 of the Core Strategy (2011), Policies DM2.1 and DM2.3 of the Development Management Policies (2013), Islington's Urban Design (2017) and the Aberdeen Park Conservation Area Design Guidelines (2002).
description: Erection of a single storey rear extension, erection of a two storey extension to the rear of the existing back addition lowering of the rear half of the existing ground floor by 500mm, at first floor level addition of a new velux rooflight to the side elevation of the main roof slope. To the side elevation of the property build-up of brickwork and the existing leaded light to roof level to create a side dormer, installation of one new window at ground floor level to the side of the proposed two storey extension. Installation of 2 x rooflights in the side slope of the back addition. To the rear elevation of the property alterations to the existing fenestration at ground and first floor level resulting in an additional window pane for the window to the rear of the back addition at first floor level and a reduction in the number of window panes by 1. Removal of existing chimney and chimney breast on top of two storey back addition. To the front elevation addition of a new French window to match the existing in the side wall at first floor level. Replacement of all existing single glazed casement and French timber windows to all elevations of the property with double glazed timber equivalents.
